sense.def:
To be called a particular name
pomeni, da nekoga ali nekaj imenujemo z njegovim imenom ali naslovom.

seg.quote: ...a novel called ‘Memoirs of a Survivor’.
All his friends call him Jo.

sense.def:
To call a person or situation something
pomeni tako opisovati človeka ali okoliščine.

seg.quote: President Nixon called his opponents traitors.

sense.def:
To call someone's name
pomeni glasno izgovoriti ime nekega človeka, da bi pritegnili njegovo pozornost.

seg.quote: Children are as likely to call for their father as for their mother.
‘Edward!’ she called.

sense.def:
To call someone
pomeni nekomu telefonirati.

seg.quote: He promised to call me soon.
‘I want to speak to Mr Landy, please.’—‘Who is calling?’

sense.def:
To call someone
pomeni tudi nekoga prositi, naj pride bliže, tako da mu zavpijemo ali telefoniramo.

seg.quote: When Margaret collapsed, I called the doctor.

sense.def:
To make a phone call
pomeni nekoga poklicati po telefonu.

To call a meeting
pomeni organizirati sestanek.

To call somewhere
pomeni iti nekam na kratek obisk.

seg.quote: We called at the Vicarage.

sense.def:
To pay a call on someone
pomeni nekoga na hitro obiskati.

seg.quote: Doctors have no time these days to make regular calls.

sense.def:
A call for something
je zahteva ali želja, da bi bilo nekaj narejeno ali priskrbljeno.

seg.quote: Labour MPs renewed their call for the abolition of the House of Lords.
There is little call for his services.

sense.def:
A bird's call
je glas, s katerim se oglaša ptica.

To call for someone or something
pomeni iti po nekoga.

seg.quote: I'll call for you about eight.
I called at the station for my luggage.

sense.def:
To call for an action
pomeni zahtevati, da se neki dogodek zgodi.

seg.quote: The declaration called for an immediate ceasefire.

sense.def:
Če nekaj
calls for a particular action or quality
, potrebuje tisto dejanje ali lastnost, če hoče uspeti.

seg.quote: Controlling a class calls for all your skill as a teacher.

sense.def:
To call someone in
pomeni nekoga prositi, naj pride in nekaj stori za nas.

seg.quote: We called in the police.

sense.def:
To call something off
pomeni nekaj odpovedati.

seg.quote: We had to decide whether classes should be called off.

sense.def:
To call on someone to do something
ali
to call upon someone to do something
pomeni nekoga prositi, naj nekaj stori;

seg.quote: The Opposition called on the Prime Minister to stop the arms deal.

sense.def:
To call on someone
pomeni tudi priti k nekomu na kratek obisk.

To call something out
pomeni nekaj zavpiti.

seg.quote: ‘Where shall I put them?’ I called out.
...calling out to the porter that she'd arrived.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
calls someone out
, nekomu ukaže, naj pride na pomoč, zlasti v sili.

seg.quote: The National Guard has been called out.

sense.def:
To call someone up
pomeni nekomu telefonirati.

Če je nekdo
called up
, dobi poziv, da mora v vojsko.
